After being placed in the presence of a strong magnet, you might notice that your device continuously reads “0 μT”. Alternatively, you might find that your device reads values that are excessively higher or lower than the Earth’s average magnetic field strength (50 μT). These anomalous readings are likely the result of your device having become magnetized.
To de-magnetize your device, move it in a figure 8 in multiple dimensions. (You can do this at any time between readings, and do not need to enter Settings to do so).
The magnetometer measures the magnetic field in three dimensions, and can also be used to measure the total magnetic field.

Most magnetometers use either the Hall effect or the magneto-resistive effec. Magnetometers that use the Hall effect are composed of a flat conductive plate in each dimension through which flows an electric current. The presence of an external magnetic field causes the electrons to deviate from their straight path to a curved path, polarizing the plate perpendicular to the flow of electrons. This polarization can be measured as a difference in potential across the sides of the plate. A greater potential difference across the sides of the plate is interpreted as an increase in magnetic field strength in that given dimension. Magnetometers that use the magneto-resistive effect are composed to permanent magnets in a circuit. As the magnet is exposed to external magnetic fields, the resistance of the magnet in the circuit changes.

How MEMS Accelerometer, Gyroscope, Magnetometer Work

 

Bosch Geomagnetic Sensor Technical Specifications
Help the device to identify where the magnetic sensor data is coming from by manually locating the magnetometer.
To do this, take a small, magnet and hold it up against the back of your device. Move it around in all directions.
When you get the highest possible reading, this is the most likely location of the sensor.
On the next screen drag the purple dot to the point of the screen opposite side of the location of the sensor.
This device does not have a magnetometer
To visualize the magnetic field, tap on the screen. Move the device slowly around the field, and visualizations will appear automatically.
Map of magnetic field intensity. Credit NOAA.
Map of magnetic field inclination. Credit NOAA.
Display the magnetic field intensity as a sphere.
Display the magnetic field intensity as a colored arrow.
Display the numeric value of the magnetic field above the arrows or spheres.

To record a video of the AR experience, hold the shutter button. To stop video recording, hold shutter button again.
For best results, record the magnetic field in portrait mode.
